reviews.review_msg: The mid-terms are designed to take exactly 50 min so you better know your stuff otherwise you're gonna run out of time. Buf if you practice for the exam before hand you should do fine.
So far so good ... btu damn this stuff is hard!
Nice prof! His excellent notes make everything clear. Assignments are not hard but useful. Easy midterm and final :)
Finally a math prof that can actually teach. His notes were fantastic. Homework was actually useful homework.
She's an OK lecturer, not the most interesting but not too bad either. Her voice is definitely boring but she does crack a joke on occasion. I think her exams were FAIR, though the averages were low.

My impression of Prof Kropinski:  "Oh darn, I've made my third mistake in lecture today.  Let's all take a five minute break while I sort through my notes up at the front here."  I'm sure if you're a patient person or are REALLY interested in the material she's trying to teach you'll be okay.  Otherwise, avoid this prof or learn from the text.
Amazing prof, really knows his stuff

Had to retake the course in the fall. I wish Prof. Bamdad wouldn't mark as harsh. You'd rarely get in between marks. Most of the time he was condescending during office hours, and it would've been nice if he took the time to patiently explain concepts to students who struggle.

quizzes are lengthy. Although are not that difficult. Midterm is average but the reason i gave him only 1 as rating is his finals. Final is way too difficult. He sets it way to hard and it is no way closer to the level he teaches.

This class was brutal for me and Bamdad was very restrictivehe even disabled many of the Canvas functions.  That's all I can say against Bamdad. He is reliable and consistent, firm but fair, and reasonably accessible outside class (though not enough to meet the high student demand).  Though, often not enough time to finish quizzes/exams. 75% - A-

For his first time teaching Prof. Bamdad did an excellent job. He is very knowledgeable of the material and even stayed with students after the lecture to help them. In office hours he offered crystal clear help and he seemed he really cared about the student's success. Midterm and Final were fair.

Great guy, genuinely wants students to do well. Very easy to reach outside of class, and helpful. He has lots of energy during lectures, which can make him hard to follow at times, but he is always happy to clarify and discuss things further if you miss something. Overall a wonderful teacher/person who will go out of his way to help if you ask :)

Vijay is a solid choice for Macm316. Overall, the course was fair and deadlines were extended when needed. If your bad at math, I recommend you take no more than 2 other courses or 1 if you're really struggling atm. Quizzes were similar to hwk. Try your best on Quizzes + Computer assignments because they are the best way to earn marks (Worth 40%)!

Vijay is an authentic person. He held office hours on Saturday before our final. He's very fair with marking, and gives you enough time to do assignments. He does his best to make sure you understand. He's friendly, funny, caring and inspirational. Sometimes his writing is cluttered but he'll explain it to you if you ask. So happy he's at SFU.

He made MACM316 tolerable for me. He is very reasonable in terms of assignment due dates (he would extend assignment due dates when students are struggling), marking is fair as well. His tutorials are extremely helpful so you better not miss them unless you really really can't make it. Would strongly recommend for MACM316!

If you're not a math major, and it's been awhile since you've seen math maybe cuz of coop or something, lectures become really hard to understand, like very difficult. Sat there scratching my head. But if you go to OH, get help, he'll explain things to you well and you'll get a good understanding for exams, the computing reports and whatnot.

It was a difficult course and you need to put in a fair amount of effort, but he tried his best to make it related to real-life/practical problems and the purpose of the course clear. The computing reports were like puzzles but interesting, you can get help during OH and tutorials. He needs to be aware of cheating during quizzes/exams though.

I think he's a good prof and try to make the class interesting by relating the concepts to real life use cases. His notes have mistakes sometimes but it's math so I think it's normal.
MACM 316 is hard to understand, if you're not into math like me. I'm on the edge of failing this course if not curved, but tbh I still think JF is good lmao

Don't go to the lectures without doing the textbook readings first, because he goes through the material really fast. His class has a heavy focus on MATLAB assignments. Weekly MATLAB assignments and weekly quizzes make the course way heavier than I expected. I wish I had more time to understand math instead of looking up MATLAB commands.

I thought this course would be incredibly boring but JF includes many relevant and interesting examples in lectures. The computing reports are difficult but he is very helpful during office hours and really takes the time to explain things.

I agree with everyone who says he is disorganized, but his exams, quizzes are very fair, he follows the same pattern as before, so make sure you solve last term's papers. If you know the formulas and the process for questions you will be good. There's a weekly quiz so you have to keep up with the class.

Does not answer emails. When you go talk to him he rushes you as if he's not getting paid to be there. Not enough time on exams. Forget about partial marks. no grading criteria for assignments. lots of homework and quizzes from them weekly and not enough time for the quizzes. No one understands the concept. Don't take classes with him!!!

Gives extra chance to recover from the first few mistakes by offering an optional assignment.
His lectures are helpful if you pay attention.
Some people only come on the weekly quiz day and complain about the course.
He takes care of the class, and in-person visits are recommended.
Email responses are slow.
Seems to be energetic when delivering lectures. Lecture notes are a little hard to follow along. NEVER ANSWERS HIS EMAILS! If you take this class with him you're on your own.

He's terrible in grading. His assignments forces us to cramp everything in a one page report, and then lose marks because things are unclear in that one page. Worst graders of all time. He cares about time management and page management more than students actually learning the course in his class. We should be getting marks for knowing the material

Ralf was disorganized and kind of abandon the course mid way through the semester as he failed to release computing assignemnts and quizzes, however he made it easier for us by omitting assignemnts and quizzes. His lectures were great and detailed. His tests were fair, especially the final exam as it was similar to previous final exams.

Ralf is a solid choice for MACM316. This prof made 316 easier compared to other profs. Ignore all the people complaining that he released things late. It is true, but he gave us more than enough time to complete it and adjusted the grading criteria to give you options to not complete some quizzes/assignments. Very fair, lectures easy to understand

Ralf was fine at explaining the material and giving good lectures. However, he stopped releasing assignments, quizzes, and practice questions after the midterm only to release them all at once in the last 2 weeks of class due right before the final. Seems like a good guy but was too unorganized.

I think Professor Wittenberg is a solid choice and he is a really good lecturer, the only problem for me was that I am not quick with it comes to quizzes and I ended up not having enough time during the quiz time to complete them, but at the end he was fair and extended the deadline to complete the computing assignments and quizzes.

If you wanna be lied to for over a month about "I'll post the assignment/quiz today", only for all the missed quizzes and assignments to be made within the last 2 weeks of the semester, Ralf is your guy. Other than the laziness, he's an okay lecturer and is a nice guy. However, the laziness far outweighs any of the positives. 100% avoid if you can.

Ralf is a kind and understandable prof. However, for him to not post any assignments/quizzes for a month because of his own personal life, and forcing us to do ALL the delayed work in the VERY last 2 weeks of classes is completely unreasonable. Also, he doesn't respond to ANY emails/canvas discussions, and he never fulfill his promises in lecture.

Ralf is extremely disorganized and seems to procrastinate a lot. 70% of the assessments were forced into the last 2 weeks. This is extremely unfair as it is the busiest time for students due to finals and other courses. Overall the content of the class is fairly simple, however, the MT exam was too long time wise and few people finished.

Willing to help, knowledgeable, great lecturer, great notes. Horrible everything else. Extremely disorganized. Does not respond to e-mails. Condensed 80% of course work into the last 2 weeks of class due to procrastination. Midterm exam extremely long for 45 minutes. Few people finished. Same with quizzes. Computing assignments reasonably easy.
Puts a bunch of trick questions in the midterm's multiple choice and then blames us for doing badly on them.

Avoid this professor at all cost for this course. Confusions and errors during the lecture and yet, challenges us with difficult quizzes and midterm. Come on the quiz is only worth 1.5% each and not necessarily to make it hard and long which often needs more than 10 mins to complete it correctly.

Half of the things in the lectures are useless and are never tested, makes errors often, confusing students. When the class did bad on a quiz, he blames the class for not understanding the material. But guess who is the one that failed to teach the material?
If I got a dollar for each time John Stockie gives a question that is not related to the homework I would be rich.

he'll explain coding or computers, but ends up telling us the wrong information, and when someone questions him on it, he says "i don't actually know, i'm not a computer scientist." he often makes huge mistakes, and ends up re-explaining and saying "ignore everything i just said" which is such a waste of time. answers questions very condescendingly

Homework problems are designed to waste your time as majority of it never shows on the quiz. Problems assigned are sometimes not even relevant to what is being tested in the course. Quizzes are designed to lower your mark in the class since he doesn't curve or scale
Being difficult for no reason
Horrible, that's all I can say.

John is a very knowledgeable professor and it shows in his lectures. My only compliant is that he isn't very approachable. Whenever questions were asked in class, he would cut off the person asking to provide a condescending half-answer. I also found some of the quiz marking to be questionable, however this was not the case for the midterm or final
Amazing professor. The lectures were clear, fair exams. I learned a lot in his macm 316 class.
An amazing prof. I would highly recommend taking MACM 316 with John.

MACM316 is known as a hard class, however with John "ACADEMIC COMBACK" Stockie, this class was much more bearable than intended. Lectures are clear and concise with mandatory IClickers throughout the weeks, very light hearted and hilarious guy. John always has methods to get "free marks". 5/5 Prof.

John is probably the best math teacher I've ever had. His class is funny and easily to understand. He prepared carefully before each class and patiently answered questions raised by every student.I can say MACM316 is one of my favourite classes I have ever taken because my professor is John Stockie.

I've had many proffs online, but He's probably one of the best, he keeps lectures more interesting and interactive than others. I actually wanted to study the material and I found a lot of it pretty interesting, and he played a part in that. His explanation of the material is clear and quizzes and exams are based on the examples in class

I would say the ingredients to this course is 80% - john stockie laugh, and 20% - theory isnt as hard as expected even if u havent taken math in a while, 1000% time crunch stress, and 4000% online covid structure stress. I am aware these dont add up to 100 but its probably cus of machine epsilon
Great prof, decent lectures (iClickers reef for that 5%) I am just terrible at the material. I got 33% on my midterm and 42% on my final. I still passed. *insert john stockie laugh*

He is a really good teacher. I had heard some horrific stuff about MACM 316 but 316 with him has been a very good experience. If you have to take MACM 316 for your degree take it with him you won't regret it.
Love this Prof
Exams highly depend on the final answer as opposed to your work. Barely any time to upload submissions for quizzes. He can teach, but he can't assess students properly. Avoid at all costs.
I am giving a poor rating due to the usage of iClicker Reef. There are free alternatives available. and I am unhappy paying for yet another cost.

Hes passionate about the course he teaches and his lectures are great. This term he started using iclickers for the first time but it was just for participation and didnt matter if you got the right answer or not. There's weekly quizzes and almost weekly assignments as well. Overall if you go to lectures and do homework you should be fine.

Very Passionate about numerical analysis and he seems like he genuinely enjoys teaching this course. His exams were very fair, but his computing assignments can be a bit challenging. Would take any course again with him!

He is definitely a responsible professor with full of passion to his class and lecture. You will feel his enthusiasm for mathematics. His midterm got some tricky but inspired questions. Pretty useful for you to understand the course material though! Also, his computing assignment is not too difficult with his provided code. Take it with him!

Clearly very passionate about what he's teaching and does a fairly good job explaining concepts in depth in lectures. Discrete math is one of the harder subjects so you can't expect him to give easy marks.

Best math teacher I've ever had! Love how he explains the motivation behind methods and concepts, rather than just stating what they are. He tends to drop hints about exams and assignments in lectures. Go to lectures for additional context about the material, but it should be possible to do well without attending every class.
worst you can get, he hate student
the worst prof i have ever seen. Avoid him!!
he wont scale a failing avg, and i got D. it says all!
Good lecturer. Assignments long and tedious. Fair tests, but very long.

midterm average 54%, some exam questions are not covered in lecture nor assignments.assignment is super super time consuming. average at least 6 hour per assignment with clear understanding. However, this prof has knowledge of the content. if you wanna be a math nerd u should go for him, otherwise, AVOID!!

He explains things very well, but he can be kind of mean and short tempered if you ask him a question he thinks is stupid. He gives very long and involved MATLAB assignments, which are worth a large portion of the grade. He also writes long difficult exams and only allows a half-page formula sheet for the final. Study hard.
no study guide, no review, tons of work needed to do. more than half student droped class after first midterm, and the other half average is not receving more than 50 percent. john, seriously..
you dont need to study, you need prey
avoid please, I find this class too hard. he wants you to be expert, and test questions were never asked in assignments. you dont need to study, you need prey. ho

oh my god, it is true that he is a good prof indeed, however, killer exams make such a difficult course even worse!His assignments is not relevant to exam. More than half of people failed exam, and he said he is not going to curve at all! This course requires you do series of matlab programming which will not appear on exam! but assignment need it!
Avoid! He is terrible and ridiculously hard in his assignments and exams! Won't scale with a failing average.
Great prof, but assignments and midterm are pain. You have to do matlab question in assignment, and you can stuck for days.

Worst math class ever.  This prof made such a horrible class even worse.  Don't bother talking to him for help as he just looks down on you.  Just pray, if you have him as a prof, that you have good TAs otherwise you will not make it through the course without feeling violated.
The material is a bit dry.  The homework assignments are tedious and the exams is said to be easy but is not.  I think the average  of the class is failing... :(
The worst teacher I've met!

Quizzes and assignments (every. single. week.) which count for A LOT are very hard. Expect to spend at least 14 hours a week on this class. Lectures consist mostly of scarily long proofs and derivations. Midterm was super rushed but the questions weren't too bad. The final was pretty reasonable though and he seems pretty organized.

He doesnt explain concepts clearly, its only after LOTS of studying you figure out that the thing you're currently studying isnt really THAT bad. In lecture he just goes on and on with proofs and gigantic derivations that mean nothing in the end. On the plus side he's approachable.
Final is really hard, too many prove.

The course is challenging. It starts off fairly easy but quickly becomes overwhelming. Try to keep up with your weekly homework and you should be fine. I recommend going to Bens office hours, he is willing to help you. Great prof overall
Why he can get a so many good feedback?
Don't take courses with him.
The course itself is challenging regardless which prof teaches this course. Try to do best on quizs, midterm and assignments as they are pretty straight forward and easy marks if you paid the effort.
I loved his course. I would take MACM 416 with him if it was offered in the Fall. Honestly cares for his students and really nice guy. He also makes me laugh in class too.

Ben was great! Learned a lot in class. 8 quizzes and 8 computing assignments, so be prepared to put in a lot of work. He is strict, but very helpful in office hours. Make sure you listen carefully, when he says only one page reports, he means it and will give 0 otherwise. Exams and assignments are fair. Would recommend for this course!

Lectures are an expanded rundown of the FIB notes but don't necessarily help with how to answer questions. Attending tutorials are key to helping you know how to answer homework problems. There are weekly homework quizzes and MATLAB assignments and they do count for more marks that most other math courses.

Ben's lecture notes were well-organized, and crystal clear. Quizzes and exams were fair in that he did not expect us to know anything outside of the homework materials. His British accent is also pretty cool.

Ben was one of my better profs this term. He can be strict, but he becomes more likable over the term. He gives weekly quizzes and assignments. This can get hectic if you have a heavy course load. His lectures are great, although they are quite in depth. His exams are largely plug-and-chug, but there is an element of actual theory in there.
his quiz is fair as long as you attend the tutorial, you can certainly ace them.  Computing assignment is easy but time-consuming to make reports. Lecture okay, exam easy, and he's a good guy
BEST. PROF. EVAR.

Computing assignments fun, a bit long, not too hard. Lecture pace extremely fast - not for the faint of heart. Quizzes and midterm about twice as long as I would consider reasonable. Final a bit shorter but very difficult. He does scale heavily though, so don't freak out if you fail a couple of quizzes. Just don't fall behind on understanding.

Ben can be quite rude. He talks as if he is your boss. He gives quizzes out that require much more than 10 minutes to do. Midterms are difficult for the time given. Computing Assignments are quite fair.

Ben is the best. Lots of homework in this class (weekly quizzes, hw sets taking between 6 to 8 hours) and computing assignments every week (also 6-8 hours). Totally fair guy and as long as you can put in the work you'll do fine.

Ben is alright, but his lectures can be a bit boring and he makes quite a bit more mistakes with his lecture notes than other professors (this has luckily been caught by students during lecture). Computing assignments are long, but fair. Quizzes are long; you probably won't have time to finish them. I honestly learned more by just reading the text.

heavy workload, especially the weekly Matlab assignments. He expects students to do so much without even teaching us how to use it. Very least instructions are given, and he told us what functions we should've been using after the assignments are due, like seriously? There are just many other good MACM316 profs out there. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST.

Great professor, his research area is in the realm of numerical analysis, so he's very knowledgeable about the topics he teaches.  You have to learn Matlab ASAP in order to do well on the computing assignments. If you're failing the computing assignments go to his office hour and ask for help, you can do extra credit work to save your grade.
He is very knowledgeable and does good research but you can tell that he has no interest in teaching. Would avoid him in future classes.
+ very nice person + explains things well + interested in the material

Great programming assignments, had one every couple weeks, and they were quite interesting. I'm from a computing science background,  so applying the methods from class made the math I studied thus far a lot more relevant and practical. His lectures were organized.  Exams were fair. He seems interested in the material and the students.

Ben's midterms and final were not difficult however I found both too long for the given time constraints. Moreover, from my experience in the Spring 2015 semester do your assignments in Python, Java, C or a programming language of your choice as Matlab later on fudged my programming abilities when diving back to C++.

He is very organized. Unlike some other professors that I know at SFU, he has a very organized set of lecture notes. Examsquizzes include topics from every single concept covered in the class (And yes, you need to study his notes too!). Lectures sometimes get very hard to follow.  He is good overall and I recommend him.
A pretty usualnormal grading scheme for a MACM or MATH course. There's quite a bit of work required for homeworkcomputing assignments, but overall pretty fair. Exams are not too difficult.
policy sucks.....!

Great lectures, fair exams, pretty interesting assignments. However if you aren't great at programming you may have a bad time with MATLAB. Gives out incomplete notes which you are expected to fill in, I found all this strategy did was prevent me from listening in class, as he goes through complicated material fast and you scramble to keep up.
lectures are well-organized; exams are not too hard; only downside is the e-policy.

Very clear and concise lectures, notes are great. As long as you attend lectures and take notes, the quizzestests are relatively easy. Quizzes are straight from weekly assignments and midterm was based off quizzes, with a little more theory. You do have to learn matlab on your own, but if you already have a language it's not that difficult.

Braindead policies (you are not even allowed to use your laptoptabletphone to quickly look something up in class); Every assignment includes a very tedious "report" where you have to write detailed explanations about what you did and why, and even describe how the assignment helped you learn; Matlab required to pass the course but not provided.
Lectures are copied from the textbook. Almost weekly quizzes and computing assignments. Quizzes are based on homework questions. Midterm was hard. Class average: 44%. Final was ok.

His midterm was designed to basically be impossible to finish in the 50 minutes given but his final was very fair (took questions straight from hw/quizzes). His lectures focus a lot on theory/proofs but he tests largely on application making his lectures at times pointless to even attend. Overall nice guy but expect to work hard.

his lectures are very unclear and monotone, midterm and assignment are super difficult, and final is "Hall Of Fame" (if you play NBA 2K, you know what I mean). The worst part is he didn't do any curve or scale, which makes over 50% failing the class. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Expected a better grade, a bit surprised. But he made the course easier on us, work wise, and we learned the important stuff. Isn't too strict about the cheat sheet, which is nice cause it resulted in less memorizing. Not the best comunicator, Ralf W. is better, but he's still good enough to learn well from.

If you have to take MACM 316, Steven Ruuth is THE MAN! He takes what would have otherwise been a dry and hellish GPA killer into an interesting and enjoyable class. He is one of - no, he IS the best prof I have had at this university. I can't say enough good things about this prof!

Great teacher. Lectures are very useful. Midterm was easy, but final was kinda tough. Assignments were fair, and marking was very fair. Only issue is that he teaches by going through pre-written slides, which isn't the best method for a math class.

The best professor for MACM 316.  Easy midterm, fair final, and relatively easy assignments (all from book).  VERY fair marker as well.  Definitely recommended over other profs teaching this course (guaranteed pass). A++
I took MACM 316 with him and all I can say is he is the best. Highly recommended. Easy midterm and fair final.

Smart guy, tests aren't too difficult and homework isn't weekly.  My only issue is he does his lectures by going through pre-written slides.  For a math class, this is far less effective than working through examples and writing them on the fly, at least I think.  Textbook is only good for formulas, terrible for explaining things.
I have strong respect to his knowledge. His is easy-going, knows everything about his course and stat and even the way to study. Exams are fair.
Excellent. Teaches well, knows his stuff, marks fairly. The textbook is horribly confusing if you're not a math-whiz so find a replacement (I did and it helped).

Pretty good prof.  The volume of course material is massive, especially in the second half of the course, though depth is limited and homework/test coverage is quite sparse.  His tests have low totals though,(MT was /19) so don't miss too many marks!
workload is pretty light.  Only 6 assignments in the semester and they were not too difficult.  Exams are fair and you should do well if you understand the assignments.
Very good prof! His midterm and final were very fair and questions asked on final and MT were correlated with HW problems.
Fairly strong, explains well. Tests aren't difficult.
good lectures. fair exams and assignments. in fact, he made macm 316 kind of interesting and less scary. nice prof.
Easy midterm and final.
good prof, good notes, fair midterm. MACM 316 is boring, but can't blame him.
He's an excellent prof.
Remarkably unremarkable.
No Comments
He has good notes, but he can put you to sleep reading them. gives very easy exams and homework. Could smile more, alwyas sotra grumpy.
Notes better than lecture, once you got a chance to read.  Easy midterm but kills on final.  Just do well on assignment then you'll do ok!  Always same combination of jeans/shirt, LOL!
No Comments

He is quite an easy prof. and it is not hard to get a good grade, but he seems to not remember that much about the material.  Whenever I asked him stuff, he always said  .........well...  and then avoided my question! Also he keeps using the same notes se
He is simply great!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
boring, unhelpful, cryptic, wont answer ques. hard exam
Good prof, and SUPPER EASSY.   A+++  YAY !!!
Brenda is the best Professor I ever had in SFU. she is very caring and inspiring. I don't like maths but I started like it more because of her. This course is very tough but she tried her best.

MACM316 demands a lot of attention, especially if you're rusty on the prerequisites. Brenda tries her best to accommodate and adjust marks. Doing well on quizzes/labs doesn't correlate well into midterm performance (also longer than expected).  Decided to drop and focus on less frantic classes. Anyone who finishes labs without TA help is godly.

Tough but fair, Brenda is a good teacher who will challenge you with more thought provoking questions. My one complaint against her is that her first midterm was too long, but she apologized for it and made an effort to correct the scores. Taking a class with her is tough but better than taking the easy way out.

Very respectful and puts in effort. Brenda really tries to teach the material well and shows examples of applications in the real world which is useful. She is accessible and obviously puts in a lot of time teaching/grading. This course is challenging, but is expected of a third year level course. Overall, great professor; one of the better ones.

First, her writing is hard to read and she wrote really fast. Second, she is a tough grader. The quizzes and computing reports are hard to do, and they worth 40% !!!!! The midterm was hard with an average of 28/60.  PLSPLSPLS avoid her courses. Ur GPA will get fxxked by this course.

Her class is hard to put it simply. However in this class like no other I felt like i learned how to learn and then apply what I have learned.  Thank you Brenda, your a great prof and an amazing person. The class is intense with a full course load, but it's worth taking a course with her.
Good professor. However, tests are difficult and very long (ie. you need to work at full speed for the whole time or you will not finish).

She's an effective enough teacher, definitely better than the average SFU teacher. With that being said, she's quite a difficult professor. Her exams are far too long and she tries to teach more content than is reasonable is the short class time. I'd say take it with another professor, Brenda is more work than she's worth.

She's a nice enough person but the course was combination of difficult and boring. Her computing assignments took a long time. Her exams are both difficult and lengthy.  She teaches well but expects a lot from her students. I'd advise taking it with another professor.

Clear and nice professor. Very difficult exams. Expects a lot out of her students. Despite her being a good lecturer, I'd take it with someone else if, due to the amount of work she'll expect from you.

TBH, if you are good at calculus then you would love to take this course with her for sure since I think she is more like a prof that can make you learn a lots if you love math. However, it's not in my case since I am not really good at math and this course requires a great understanding for the stuff you learned in linear algebra and calculus.
Don't know what she assignment meaning. Never take her course ever

Horrible class! She's so mean. Can you image take math class have to focus on grammar?never take her math course if u not good at English grammar. You will face lowest grade even you have right answer!
The course is tough.  He did a reasonably good job at it.  The non-curve and higher of the two grading options should pass most students.
Useless lecture, difficult assignments. DO NOT take him.

Accessible outside class. He would give you a one on one pep talk if you are having a rough time in class. Weekly quizzes and assignments, yada yada, a typical math course. Study hard, go to tutorials and computing workshop, make friends.
AVOID!AVOID!AVOID!

WORST prof I have EVER met in my LIFE!!! Quiz and exams are so hard and time consuming that you won't be able to finish it. Assignments are marked extremely strict. The exams and assignments are WAAAAAAAY harder than other profs. If you are not a genius in MATH, then avoid him at ALL COST! Save your money and spend it on more meaningful things.

His teach skills are not too bad. But he is absolutely a terrible person. He never replies your email. The suggestion he gives to you is something like "you should drop the class". He forces students to go his lectures in some ways. Not a respectable prof.

I'm satisfied with my grade, still wasn't a good experience. Workload much higher compared to prev offerings with other profs. Assignments are long, tedious, and somewhat ambiguous (even for top students I've talked to). Lectures just sit+listen, might as well been online. True it's scaled, you'll likely turn out ok, but it's unnecessary stress.

Everyone should take all the comments below with a grain of salt. I'm in CS  and Math isn't my strongest subject.   It's true he doesn't show us examples in class, but he does reference the sub-chapters we're responsible for knowing. He gives us assignments and quizzes with solutions and if you just study from that, you'll do fine since he scales

Tests are tough. They are not designed to be finished as he states. We also have to write papers and coding assignments that are essential to passing to course, where each assignment is worth less than 1%. They take 10+ hours. He compares us with previous sems about the fairness of exams. We get 20 eqs, prev sems - full cheat sheets. Worst prof.
He does not teach you how to solve problems! Hes lecture is useless, if u want to pass the course, u need to read the text for whole semester! avoid at all cost.
Excellent professor! MUST TAKE MACM 316 with him!  Garunteed A+, free assignments, midterm marks. A lot of help from TA AND HIM.   I am just kidding.

There is not justification to the workload he demands from his students. MATLAB assignments are literally a slap in the face considering how little they are worth and how long they take to complete. Avoid at all costs if possible. I can attest to each and every negative review posted thus far. Extremely difficult exams. Key word: extreme

Let me put things into perspective for you:   - Weekly required MATLAB assignments (worth  1% each), must obtain a passing grade on them to be eligible to write the final.
